s.info: Patient, Tony McKay, presents with a fever and sore stomach.
He reports feeling dizzy and nauseous.
He has vomited twice this morning.
He denies taking any medicine to treat symptoms.

o.info: Physical examination reveals a temperature of 104 degrees.
He has a history of vomiting and diarrhea.

a.info: Primary diagnosis is a high temperature and fever, secondary to food poisoning.
Differential diagnoses could include other causes of symptoms, but these are not considered at this time.

p.info: The patient is advised to take a six-hour course of anti-diarrheal medication every six hours until it is finished.
He will be treated with a 24-hour course of anti-diarrheal medication.
The patient is advised to report any new symptoms within 24 hours.
